com.sb.elsinore

Class PID

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sb.elsinore.PID
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class PID
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The PID class calculates the Duty cycles and updates the output control.
    Author:
    Doug Edey

    • Constructor Detail

      • PID

        public PID(Temp aTemp,
   java.lang.String aName,
   double aDuty,
   double aTime,
   double p,
   double i,
   double d,
   java.lang.String gpio)
        Create a new PID.
        Parameters:
        aTemp - Temperature Object to use
        aName - Name of the PID
        aDuty - Duty Cycle % being set
        aTime - Cycle Time in seconds
        p - Proportional value
        i - Integral Value
        d - Differential value
        gpio - GPIO to be used to control the output

    • Method Detail

      • updateValues

        public void updateValues(java.lang.String m,
                double duty,
                double cycle,
                double setpoint,
                double p,
                double i,
                double d)
        Update the current values of the PID.
        Parameters:
        m - String indicating mode (manual, auto, off)
        duty - Duty Cycle % being set
        cycle - Cycle Time in seconds
        setpoint - Target temperature for auto mode
        p - Proportional value
        i - Integral Value
        d - Differential value

           int duty,
           double delay,
           double p,
           double i,
           double d)
        Set the cooling values.
        Parameters:
        gpio - The GPIO to be used
        duty - The new duty time in seconds
        delay - The start/stop delay in minutes
        p - the proportional value
        i - the integral value
        d - the differential value
